page.title: 09 THE STORMBRINGERS
page.content: It all started with an advertisement written by Norman Bristowe in the Evening Telegraph sometime in August of l983. A meeting was arranged for anyone interested in American Football. Over thirty people turned up and practice sessions were organised every Sunday afternoon at North Park, Kettering. The Club was soon christened "Stormbringers" after the dragster which beat the quarter mile record at Santa Pod. The Stormbringers were filmed on Anglia television which helped publicity and attracted people to the meetings. Soon after their initial success they moved to Northampton training first on the racecourse and later transferring to Obelisk Sports Ground. A solid silver helmet worth several hundred pounds is awarded to the best player at the end of the season.
